FAILED 5 of 9

...

Failed Tests            Total   Fail    Failed %
===================================================
testrand                    9      5     55.56%

APR 1.3.2 
Mac OS X 10.4.11 (PPC)
Darwin Kernel Version 8.11.0: Wed Oct 10 18:26:00 PDT 2007; root:xnu-792.24.17~1/RELEASE_PPC

I found a mention of this issue in the archives for the developers' list at http://www.nabble.com/-vote--Release-apr--util--1.3.2-td17903737.html but I googling has not turned up any mention of a fix and searching here (for "testrand" with product APR) only finds 3 irrelevant reports of other bugs. The mention on the developers' list suggested to me that this might be a genuine bug and possibly worth reporting as I'm still seeing it.

test/README suggests that running testall with -v should produce report more information but I get the same output in that case for this test. The README also says that known failures are reported in ../STATUS but find reports no files containing "STATUS", "Status" or "status" in their file names within the source hierarchy.
I found this bug while testing APR before a release on a Cell BE system (a PPC core with 8 accelerator cores).
creator: Lucian.Grijincu@gmail.com
sf@sfritsch.de
text: I have the same test failure under linux on powerpc.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Thanks Stefan, it's definitely an endianness error in that case, but I'll confirm
on non-motorola chipset.

creator: sf@sfritsch.de
text:
This is a autoconf problem. AC_C_BIGENDIAN is broken in 2.62. See
http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=490820

If I run buildconf with autoconf 2.61 and rebuild, testrand passes.
Later apr release tarballs were packaged with a version of autoconf without this bug. Closing.
creator: sf@sfritsch.de
